intro: Fagara mantchurica var. okinawaensis, commonly known as Okinawa fagara, is a shrub native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
